revised_title: Effects of X-rays on Radioactive Sulphate Uptake in Tissues and Cartilage
tldr: The study investigates the effects of X-rays on the uptake of radioactive sulfate in mouse tissues and calf costal cartilage. The results show that X-ray exposure reduces sulfate uptake in cartilage, and replacing air with nitrogen can decrease the radiation's impact. Some substances, like L-cysteine, can protect against the radiation's effects. The findings contribute to understanding the effects of ionizing radiation on mucopolysaccharide secretion.
